note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the CPC scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
A44C11/02 covered by A44C5/18

title-part.text: Brooches or clips in their decorative or ornamental aspect

reference.text: pendants, crosses, crucifixes or charms A44C25/00; settings for holding gems or the like A44C17/02
frames or housings for storing same A47G1/12

CPC-specific-text.text: Honorific badges, e.g. ribbon holders for decoration
which can be separated into parts, e.g. to be worn by two persons

title-part.text: Fastenings for bracelets or wrist-watch straps

reference.text: settings for holding gems or the like A44C17/02; devices for putting-on or pulling-off bracelets A47G25/901

CPC-specific-text.text: Bracelets specially adapted for other functions or with means for attaching other articles
providing information, e.g. bracelets with calendars
with means for attaching a writing instrument or a memo pad
Bracelets in the form of a ring, band or tube of rigid material
with links threaded on at least one filamentary core

reference.text: ornamental chains made of pearls A44C11/002

CPC-specific-text.text: with links threaded on a band
the band also made of links
with links made of one piece with integral connecting means
with links made of one piece and linked together by one connecting element
with links made of more than two elements including connecting elements

title-part.text: characterised by the way of fastening to a wrist-watch or the like

CPC-specific-text.text: Attachment of fasteners to straps or chains
Hooks provided with pivoting closure means
Fasteners provided with a turnable clamping lever
Fasteners provided with a V-shaped spring-tongue male member
Fasteners provided with at least one push-button acting parallel to the main plane of the fastener and perpendicularly to the direction of the fastening
Fasteners locked by sliding or rotating of the male element of the fastener; Turn-button fasteners
Fasteners with locking means acting parallel to the main plane of the fastener and perpendicularly to the direction of the fastening
with the two ends of the strap or chain overlapping each other and fastened by an action perpendicularly to the main plane of these two ends
with the two ends of the strap or chain abutting each other or sliding in the main plane or a plane parallel to the main plane of these two ends
with the two ends sliding transversally to the main plane of the strap or chain
Fasteners specially adapted for necklaces or bracelets made of pearls
provided with retaining means for several strings of pearls
with a pivotable back clamping arm
with an ear gripping member mounted, e.g. pivotably, at the upper end of a back arm
Earrings covering the upper portion of the ear

reference.text: settings for holding gems or the like A44C17/02

CPC-specific-text.text: connected or interlinked to each other
openable or able to be broken for safety reasons
worn on several fingers or between fingers

reference.text: fastening devices for watch or ornamental chains A44C5/18
rosaries A44C23/00; making such chains D04D9/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Jewelry adherable on the human body
Jewels transformable into other jewels, e.g. finger rings transformable into ear-rings
Jewellery dispersing perfume or the like
Jewellery holding or retaining articles, e.g. eyeglasses
Jewellery with monograms or other inscription
Jewellery specially adapted to be worn on a specific part of the body not fully provided for in groups A44C1/00 to A44C9/00
combined with other jewels, e.g. earrings
on the teeth, e.g. settings or decorations
on the leg, foot or toes
Gems made of several cut pieces
Gems provided with grooves or notches, e.g. for setting
Gems provided with a cavity, e.g. for containing another gem
or the like, e.g. for ornaments or decorations
with automatic locking action, e.g. by using a spring
with the gem sliding along guiding rails
with means for maintaining a pivoted position
Setting gems in a plurality of non coplanar table top planes

title-part.text: Devices for preventing pilfering of watches or jewellery

reference.text: coins specially adapted to operate coin-freed mechanisms G07F1/06

title-part.text: Beer or gambling coins or tokens, or the like
Miscellaneous fancy ware for personal wear, e.g.

reference.text: suspension loops or rings A44C3/008; settings for holding gems or the like A44C17/02

CPC-specific-text.text: forming a container, e.g. for pictures
Jewellery worn on collars, e.g. on shirts

title-part.text: Making jewellery or other personal adornments

reference.text: single step processes, see the relevant places, e.g. making rings from wire B21F37/00
